It will be seen from the note that there are other versions of the story, and that in these the vow is said to have been made after the death of Christ. It is easy to see how a confusion might have arisen if James, whether having heard from others or himself having witnessed the events of the Last Supper, had shaped his vow after the Lord’s own words ‘ Ι will not drink henceforth of the fruit of the vine, till the kingdom of God shall come? There is, I think, a ring of genuineness about the narrative.
